# ðŸ§­ Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We are dedicated to creating a welcoming, safe, and respectful community for everyone who uses or contributes to **FM26 Mod Manager** â€” regardless of experience level, background, or identity.  
We expect all contributors, maintainers, and community members to act in ways that promote mutual respect and inclusion.

---

## Our Standards

Examples of behavior that helps build a positive environment include:

- Being kind and respectful in all communications  
- Offering constructive feedback instead of personal criticism  
- Welcoming new ideas, even when they differ from your own  
- Giving and gracefully accepting feedback  
- Focusing on what benefits the broader Football Manager modding community

Examples of unacceptable behavior include:

- Harassment, insults, or personal attacks  
- Discrimination based on identity, ability, or beliefs  
- Public or private harassment of any kind  
- Publishing othersâ€™ private information without consent  
- Conduct that disrupts or damages community collaboration

---

## Our Responsibilities

Project maintainers are responsible for clarifying and enforcing community standards.  
They have the right to remove or edit contributions, comments, or other interactions that violate this Code of Conduct, or to ban individuals temporarily or permanently if necessary.

---

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies to all project spaces, including GitHub issues, pull requests, discussions, and community channels related to **FM26 Mod Manager**.

---

## Enforcement

If you experience or witness behavior that violates this Code of Conduct:

- Report it by opening a **private GitHub issue** or by contacting the project maintainer directly.
- Reports will be reviewed promptly and handled with confidentiality and fairness.

Maintainers will communicate the outcome of enforcement actions when appropriate.

---

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is adapted from the  
[**Contributor Covenant**](https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 2.1.
